proced.procDesc: This document provides an overview of bicycle components.

section.sectionDesc: This document provides an overview of bicycle components.
This document provides an overview of the key components of a bicycle. It includes descriptions and references to visual aids within a larger technical manual.

subsection.sectionDesc: The following figures are referenced throughout this document:

subsubsection.sectionDesc: The bicycle frame is the main structural component, typically constructed from metal tubes welded together. It provides the foundation for all other parts.
The wheels enable movement and consist of the following parts:
subsubsection.listItem: Hub: The central part of the wheel.
Spokes: Connect the hub to the rim.
Metal Rim: The outer circular part of the wheel.
Rubber Tire: Provides traction and cushioning.

subsubsection.subsubsectionTitle: Subsection: Seat and Seat Post (Refer to Figure 1.3)
subsubsection.sectionDesc: The seat and seat post provide a comfortable riding position. The seat post inserts into the seat tube, allowing for height adjustment.

subsubsection.subsubsectionTitle: Subsection: Handlebar and Stem (Refer to Figure 1.4)
subsubsection.sectionDesc: The handlebar and stem control steering and provide a mounting point for brake levers and shifters.
The cranks are levers that extend from the bottom bracket to the pedals, transferring pedaling force to the drivetrain.
The pedals are platforms for the feet, attaching to the cranks and receiving pedaling force.

subsubsection.subsubsectionTitle: Subsection: Chain and Gears (Refer to Figure 1.7)
subsubsection.sectionDesc: The chain and gear system (drivetrain) transmit power from the pedals to the rear wheel. Key components include:
subsubsection.listItem: Front Chain Ring: The large gear attached to the crank.
Rear Freewheel (or Cassette): The set of gears on the rear wheel.
Front and Rear Derailleurs: Mechanisms that move the chain between gears.
Cables: Connect the shift lever to the derailleurs.

subsubsection.sectionDesc: The brake system provides stopping power and includes:
subsubsection.listItem: Actuators (on Handlebars): Levers operated by the rider.
Brake Cable: Transmits force from the actuator to the brakes.
Brake Calipers: Clamp onto the wheel rim or rotor.
Brake Pads: Provide friction to slow or stop the wheel.

subsection.sectionDesc: All parts are typically available from certified part distributors. The table below provides a summary of each component.

tr.td: Enable movement; includes hub, spokes, rim, tire.
Provides rider comfort and adjustable height.
Transfers pedaling force to the drivetrain.
Transmit power to the rear wheel.
